text: Ronald Sidney Tauranac (13 January 1925 â€“ 17 July 2020) was a British- Australian engineer and racing car designer. He worked with Formula One driver Jack Brabham and helped founded the Brabham constructor and racing team in 1962. Tauranac owned and managed the Brabham team until 1972, when he sold it to Bernie Ecclestone. He was born in Gillingham, Kent. Tauranac died in Sunshine Coast, Queensland on 17 July 2020, aged 95. ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Australian businesspeople Category:British businesspeople Category:People from Kent
title: Ron Tauranac
